column.name: AllowApply
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to Apply schedule changes to the orders.

column.name: AllowLeveling
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to use the automatic resource leveling capabilities.

column.name: AllowUpdateAllEmployees
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify the schedule for all employees.

column.name: AllowUpdateAllEquipments
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to update the schedule for all equipment. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be able to modify the schedule for equipment that is not in the userÆs work centers.

column.name: AllowUpdateAllResources
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to update the schedule of all resources. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be allowed to update the schedule of resources that are not linked to him or her.

column.name: AllowUpdateAllWorkCenters
column.description: If true, the user will be able to modify the schedule of all work centers. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be allowed to update the schedule for work centers to which he or she is not assigned.

column.name: AllowUpdateBarStyles
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to update the system-wide settings for Bar Styles. Bar Styles define the presentation options for the Gantt chart and the Resource Reservation chart in the Dispatching Board, for example, color, length, height, shape, etc.

column.name: AllowUpdateDispatchSequence
column.description: If true, the user is allowed to create and delete generic sequence constraints between orders to which he/she has permissions for update. This field does not grant permissions to update operation sequences (wip_operation_sequence)

column.name: AllowUpdateDuration
column.description: If true, the user is allowed to manually modify the duration of any activity to which he/she has permissions for updates

column.name: AllowUpdateLinkedResources
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify the schedule for all resources that are linked to him or her (RESOURCE_RESOURCE_LINK).

column.name: AllowUpdateOwnWorkCenters
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify the schedule of his work centers (EMPLOYEE_WORK_CENTER).

column.name: AllowUpdateSelf
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify his or her own schedule.

column.name: AllowUpdateSupervisedEmployee
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify the schedule for all employees that he or she supervises (SUPERVISOR_EMPLOYEE).

column.name: AllowUpdateWorkCenterEquipmen
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to modify the schedule of all Equipment in the EmployeeÆs work centers.

column.name: ViewAllEmployees
column.description: If true, the user will be able to see the schedule for all employees. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be able to see the schedule for employees that he or she is not supervising.

column.name: ViewAllEquipments
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to see the schedule for all equipment. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be able to see the schedule for equipments that are not in the userÆs work centers.

column.name: ViewAllResources
column.description: If true, the user will be allowed to see the schedule for all resources. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be able to see the schedule for resources that are not linked to him or her.

column.name: ViewAllWorkCenters
column.description: If true, the user will be able to see the schedule for all work centers. If none of the userÆs roles has this permission, the user will not be able to see the schedule for work centers to which he or she is not assigned.

column.description: Numeric mean value of the test. Applies only for test of characteristic of type: Variable. Used only when the values of the test are recorded in the detailed form (DISPOSITION_READING) or in the form of summarized value

column.name: NoOfReadings
column.description: Number of readings of the value for the characteristic. Applies only for test that are executed by reading multiple values (DISPOSITION_READING)

column.description: Number of measured values that are above the defined upper specification limit

column.name: NoUnitBelowLimit
column.description: Number of measured values that are below the defined lower specification limit

column.name: NoUnitInspected
column.description: Total number of inspected units

column.name: NoUnitNonconforming
column.description: Total number of nonconforming measured values. In case of characteristics of type Variable: Sum of NoAboveLimit + NoBelowLimit. In case of characteristic of type Attribute: Number of units for which the attributive result is not conforming (based DISPOSITION_TEST_ATTRIBUTE.Conforming)

column.name: OverrideSumResults
column.description: Flag indicating that the summarized results will be populated manually instead of the automatic calculation based on multiple readings (DISPOSITION_READING)

column.name: ReadingValidation
column.description: Flag indicating whether the number of readings for the characteristic (DISPOSITION_READING): 1 - Is not verified, 2 - Must Equal to NoOfReadings, 3 - Can be smaller then NoOfReadings, 4 - Can be larger then NoOfReadings

column.name: GroupSize
column.description: Specifies the standard group size to group items in the queue. When a positive value is specified, items will be automatically grouped. When IsReversed is true, the group size is the number of items that will be reversed at a time. Applies only to new groups added to the sequence. When a zero or negative value is specified (or NULL), the queue is not grouped and no SEQUENCE_QUEUE_ITEM_GROUP records will be created for the queue.

column.name: ID
column.description: Auto increment PK.

column.name: IsReversed
column.description: When true, the sequence in which items are removed from the queue is reversed from the sequence in which items are added. When a GroupSize is specified, the reversal happens only within groups, so that items in the same group are dequeued in reverse order, but the groups themselves remain in the original order.

column.description: This sequential number specifies the order in which items were added to the queue (lowest added first). This field is not guaranteed to be sequential. When a queue is manipulated and resequenced, this field is used to determine the order in which items were added to calculate the appropriate sequence number.

column.name: EnqueueSequenceInGroup
column.description: This is the enqueue sequence of this item within the group. Items enqueued later will have higher numbers in this field.

column.name: ExternalSequence
column.description: The sequence number specified by an external system. Used only as a reference.

column.name: ID
column.description: Auto increment PK.

column.name: IsEmpty
column.description: When true, this item does not yet reference any business entity, and it is therefore only a place holder for a future item to be enqueued. When a new item is enqueued, it the business components will first attempt to update any record that IsEmpty, before creating a new item record. Empty items are created normally as part of grouping when a new group is created.

column.name: Message
column.description: Message associated with queue item.

column.name: OrderLineNo
column.description: The Order line to which the item refers. This field is populated when the item in the queue is an Order line.

column.name: OrderNo
column.description: The Order to which the item refers. This field is populated when the item in the queue is an Order.

column.name: OrderType
column.description: The Order to which the item refers. This field is populated when the item in the queue is an Order.

column.name: ProductID
column.description: The Product to which this item refers. When populated, this is considered a queue of Products. This field is also required to queue serial numbers.

column.name: Quantity
column.description: Quantity planned for this sequence number. This quantity overrides the WIP order quantity.

column.name: Sequence
column.description: Sequence number for this item, specifies where this item is in the queue. Sequence numbers are guaranteed to be sequential (always increment by 1). Items are dequeued in ascending order of Sequence. A Null in this field is interpreted as an item that is not yet added to the queue.

column.name: SequenceInGroup
column.description: This is the dequeue sequence for the item within the group. The lowest value is dequeued first from the group

column.name: SequenceQueueID
column.description: The Sequence Queue that this item belongs.

column.name: SequenceQueueItemGroupID
column.description: Specifies the group that this item belongs in this sequence. Items are automatically grouped when GroupSize is specified for the Sequence Definition. A Null in this field means that either the Sequence is not Grouped (GroupSize =< 0) or the item has not yet been enqueued.

column.name: SequenceQueueItemStatus
column.description: This is an optional status for this item. Process authors may define as many status as required by the business logic.

column.name: SerialNo
column.description: The Serial number that this item refers to. Implies that this is a queue of serial numbers.

column.name: WipOrderNo
column.description: The Wip Order to which this item refers. When populated, implies that the queue is a queue of Wip Orders.

column.name: WipOrderSequenceNo
column.description: The sequence of the child WIP order was loaded into the queue.

column.name: WipOrderType
column.description: The Wip Order to which this item refers. When populated, implies that the queue is a queue of Wip Orders.

column.name: WorkCenter
column.description: The work center where this sequence number will be processed.

column.description: If false, this queue cannot be resequenced in the Sequencing Cockpit.

column.description: The date and time after which this queue is not to be used for sequencing the entity. This field is not enforced in any BC.

column.description: The date and time from which this sequence queue is to be used. Allows multiple queues for the same entity to exist with different settings depending on the date. This field is not enforced in any BC.

column.description: If the queue is sequencing items specifically in one Facility, this is the Facility identifier.

column.description: If the queue is sequencing items of a certain group, this is the reference to the group.

column.name: LastEnqueueSequence
column.description: The Sequence number of the last item in the queue, that is, the last item Enqueued. Corresponds to the highest EnqueueSequence. Note that the item may already have been removed from the queue.

column.name: LastSequenceQueueItemID
column.description: The ID of the last item in the queue, that is, the last Enqueued item.

column.name: MaximumSize
column.description: The maximum number of items desired in the sequence. When the maximum is violated, the system will attempt to automatically dequeue the top item into the destination queue.

column.name: MinimumSize
column.description: The minimum number of items desired in the sequence. When the minimum is violated, the system will attempt to automatically enqueue the top item from the source.

column.name: Name
column.description: This is the user-specified name for the definition. The name can be used inside operations to find the appropriate sequence definition independent of the database environment.

column.name: NextSequence
column.description: The Sequence number of the first item in the queue, that is, the item that will be Dequeued next. Corresponds to the lowest Sequence.

column.name: NextSequenceQueueItemID
column.description: The ID of the first item in the queue, that is, the next item to be Dequeued.

column.name: ParentSequenceQueueID
column.description: Parent Queue ID.

column.name: PartnerID
column.description: If the queue is sequencing items specifically for one partner (supplier, customer, carrier), this is the Partner ID.

column.name: ProductionLineNo
column.description: If the queue is sequencing items for a production line, this is the production line number.

column.name: ResequenceSourceSeqQueueID
